pageContext.claim: “So one of the reasons the Democrats don't want to have a census is because the number of people in the United States, for many years -- you know, for years, you've heard 11 million; it's far greater than that. But we'll find out [how many undocumented immigrants are in the U.S.] because I'm going to do something much more accurate than the way we -- the way we did it in the census would never have been very accurate.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. undocumented immigrant population stands at roughly 11 million to 12 million, according to a range of estimates. According to the Pew Research Center, 8 million of those immigrants, or more than two-thirds, work for a living.
